definition: to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: The teacher threw the student out of the class because he was always goofing off.
sentences.chinese: 老師把那個學生趕出課堂，因爲他老在瞎鬧。

sentences.english: Don't fool around during working hours.
The teacher drove the student out of the classroom, for he kept disturbing.
sentences.chinese: 老師把那個學生趕出課堂，因爲他老在瞎鬧。

sentences.english: There's a lot of slapstick in that movie.
sentences.chinese: 那部電影中有許多瞎鬧的場面。

sentences.english: I was too tired to play with her.
sentences.chinese: 我太累了，不想陪她瞎鬧。

sentences.english: As expected I was not so good and I began to fool around and goof off.
sentences.chinese: 正如所料，我不太好，我開始瞎鬧和偷懶。

sentences.english: Tell the children to stop messing bout , I'll try to work.
sentences.chinese: 叫孩子不要在樓上瞎鬧，我要工作。

sentences.english: Because of that he always act senselessly, so the teacher sweep him out of the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 老師把那個學生趕出了課堂，因爲他老在瞎鬧。
